014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.sql.ResultSet;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
021
022/**
023 * Maps result set columns to objects.
024 *
025 * @param <T> The mapped type
026 * @see ColumnMapperFactory
027 * @see ColumnMappers
028 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing#map(ColumnMapper)
029 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
030 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable#registerColumnMapper(java.lang.reflect.Type, ColumnMapper)
031 * @see StatementContext#findColumnMapperFor(java.lang.reflect.Type)
032 */
033@FunctionalInterface
034public interface ColumnMapper<T> {
035    /**
036     * Map the given column of the current row of the result set to an Object. This method should not cause the result
037     * set to advance; allow Jdbi to do that, please.
038     *
039     * @param r            the result set being iterated
040     * @param columnNumber the column number to map (starts at 1)
041     * @param ctx          the statement context
042     * @return the value to return for this column
043     * @throws SQLException if anything goes wrong go ahead and let this percolate; Jdbi will handle it
044     */
045    T map(ResultSet r, int columnNumber, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException;
046
047    /**
048     * Map the given column of the current row of the result set to an Object. This method should not cause the result
049     * set to advance; allow Jdbi to do that, please.
050     *
051     * @param r           the result set being iterated
052     * @param columnLabel the column label to map
053     * @param ctx         the statement context
054     * @return the value to return for this column
055     * @throws SQLException if anything goes wrong go ahead and let this percolate; Jdbi will handle it
056     */
057    default T map(ResultSet r, String columnLabel, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
058        return map(r, r.findColumn(columnLabel), ctx);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Allows for initialization of the column mapper instance within a ConfigRegistry scope. This method is called once when the column mapper is first used from a
063     * ConfigRegistry.
064     * <p>
065     * Note that handles, statements, sql objects etc. all create copies of the registry, and this method will be called for every copy
066     *
067     * @param registry A reference to the {@link ConfigRegistry} that this instance belongs to.
068     */
069    default void init(ConfigRegistry registry) {}
070}
